channel.title: Projects on Anthony's Fine Site
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Anthony's Fine Site

item.title: Exploring Saturn's Moon Titan With RADAR Flybys
item.description: Sample text from some writing when I started this project: The surface properties of planetary bodies offer crucial insights into their composition and geological processes. Understanding these characteristics is particularly compelling for Saturn’s moon, Titan, due to its diverse geology and fascinating environment. Our research uses radar backscatter modeling to elucidate the surface properties of Titan’s most abundant terrain, the plains (Lopes, 2020). In addition, we emphasize the benefit of integrating Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and altimetry data, both derived from the Cassini RADAR instrument.

item.title: NASA Trajectory Reconstruction
item.description: Here are some details about my first project: It was challenging. I learned a lot. It’s something I’m proud of.
